Tonight! Online Salon to Discuss 9/11 Photography

Sep 11, 2008

Tonight BAGnewsNotes, a progressive blog that analyzes photography and visual politics, is hosting a live chat salon titled 9/11: Looking Back From Now.  Starting at 8pm EST, academics, photojournalists, photography editors, and you if you like will discuss how photographs relating the the events of 9/11/2001 are seen now.  I helped select photographs for discussion in collaboration with Michael Shaw who publishes BAGnewNotes.

On August 7th, 1924, the French tight rope walker Philippe Petit spent 45 minutes walking back and forth on a tight rope wire between the Twin Towers.  (Screen grab from documentary trailer, Man on Wire)
